statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ 16 \\ 23 \\ -9 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ 2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 3 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ 16 \\ 23 \\ -9 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ 2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
